website_summaries.verdict: A significant number of buyers who tried the Mizuno Wave Sky 2 loved the footwear's exceptional level of responsiveness and cushioning. It has the perfect combination of comfort and flexibility that the runner needed in short and extended walking and running activities. In general, the Mizuno Wave Sky 2 gained a lot of appreciation because of its well-constructed upper, fantastic design and amazing performance.
pros: Some of the runners commented that the shoe was responsive
According to those who have tried it, the footwear has excellent cushioning
Several buyers lauded its well-constructed upper
Based on some reviews, the Mizuno Wave Sky 2 was perfect for long and short runs and walks
One of the purchasers admired the shoe's flexibility
It was comfortable, a consumer noted
cons: A wearer observed that the shoe does not have aggressive lugs
As a result, the right amount of traction needed on various surfaces is not provided
According to some users, the sock liner is a little heavy

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started wearing this pair my knee problems have disappeared- I walk about 7-8 miles daily... I'm awed
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me...
customer_reviews.text: I spoke directly to the Mizuno sales rep prior to my purchase, and he without hesitation recommended these based on my preferences/characteristics. However, just didn't work out. I have an exact medium width foot and got the "D" width, but found this shoe to be a little too wide and a toe box too roomy for my comfort level. Also, contrary to the loose feel, the outsole is very stiff lacking hardly any flexibility that I prefer. So, if those features don't bother you...it seems to be a well constructed/quality shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for heavier runners.
customer_reviews.text: I am 240lbs and just did a 10k with these and a bit of running the couple of weeks before. They work as advertised, definitely absorb a lot and don't make me feel sore the next day. I'll buy them again. The only downside is that there is already some wear on the top edge of the shoe, from my foot rubbing. Could be my weirdly large feet, but in any case I would have thought that the top edge of the shoe (where you enter with your foot, that surrounds your ankle) is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: rapunzel

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to put these in rotation
customer_reviews.text: I just wore out a pair of Brooks Beast 16s, and almost bought a replacement pair, but wanted to shop around a bit. Glad I did. The Brooks are terrific, but the Wave Sky 2s feel incredible. I increased my speed and feel significantly less knee discomfort. I may get another pair of Brooks, or try the Hokas, but the Mizunos have earned a go-to spot in my daily jog.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Skrinyaz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful jogging shoes
customer_reviews.text: This mizuno shoes is amazing, the suspension system is out of this world. I suffer from bad kness which hurt when jogging, but with this shoes the impact on my knees is almost nothing. Very nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Yasser

customer_reviews.title: Premium with a capital P
customer_reviews.text: My first Mizuno and not my last. Good cushion while also feeling stable. Best part is walking around with them on hard floors. They sound like dress shoes clacking as you walk, in a good way. Premium finish all over. They look better in person and one of the few shoes I've had that i actually think look pleasing. Just look at the primo lining oozing out of the ankle area. It's so premium the shoe can't contain it! I paid 70$ for them, but can honestly say they're worth full price. I couldn't say the same about most shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I really like how the shoe fits and how soft and comfortable it is. A little pricey but you get what you pay for, right? I will likely buy another pair in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Least ive ever gotten for my hard earned money.
customer_reviews.text: Yea they are comfortable but dont buy them unless you just like spending 70 dollars a week on shoes because thats al they are gonna last. Ive been wearing these on and off for 7 days and already the seam on the sides are busted on both of them and the fabric is rolling off the heel lip. Buy them if you want but they are junk and are worth about 10$. If i bought theses shoes and wore them evey day i would spend ober 4 thousand a year on shoes.......ridiculous. dont buy them.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe If It Fits Your Needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after developing plantar fasciitis, and they have helped out quite a bit. However, you should know what you are buying. This is a heavy shoe and is very neutral. It has a pretty high stack height, which causes a bit of instability. They are great for walking or jogging long distances, but I would hesitate doing any serious running in them. They also run about 1/4 size larger than the New Balance I typically wear. I played with the lacing a bit and they work, but I would probably go a 1/2 size down if I buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Haystack

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are falling apart within a month
customer_reviews.text: My three year old pair of Wave Sky shoes look newer than this pair I purchased within the last month. The fabric is tearing in a place that doesn't rub against anything. It's tearing in the same places on both shoes. Something is very wrong with these shoes. It's risky to buy shoes on Amazon because you never know how they were stored (climate conditions, length of time). I'd recommend buying instead from a trusted shoe dealer/local running store.
customer_reviews.author: K.Ko.

customer_reviews.title: One of The Best Shoes Out There IMO
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is incredible in terms of the way it hugs your feet since the front flap is fixed in place with some type of elastic material so it can't slide around and possibly cause discomfort from the shoe laces rubbing against the top part of your feet for example. The cushioning is nice and the shoe has nice "bounce" to it which feel like it's facilitating forward movement. Seems quite durable and for the price is an incredible value imo.
customer_reviews.author: ktrader

customer_reviews.title: Super soft run
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is they show a good bit of wear on the padding around your ankles. Not sure why, but it's there. Overall, a bit heavy, but very comfortable and like running on a cloud. Great training shoes for anyone that likes a little extra padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Feels good for over pronation
customer_reviews.text: I just received the shoes and they are dirty. It's like someone has worn them and returned them so I gave them 3 stars. As far as the fit, they fit well. My heel has support and since I am flat-footed & over pronate, they appear to correct my issue. There is also a nice cush in the heel. The true test is when I take them out next week for some jogging time. I will update my findings then.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl walters

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, well padded particularly at the heel
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable and we'll cushioned. It makes me want to go out and run. Th shoe puts a lot of padding to the heel make you feel every step you landed is on your heel bouncy, the front is less padded, and the shoe is well insolated, can feel warm after the run
customer_reviews.author: ACW1120

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable  shoes for trail run & gym
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best sneakers I've had for jogging. Weight - 0,738 Lb. Them soft, good for daily running , long distance and workout.Ready to use in the first day without any discomfort in the feet. The shoelaces are strong and do not relax. I would recommend for a wide foot with neutral pronation. Arch type - high. The ventilation of the feet is excellent, the feet are dry after running 5 mile. I liked the black color for the gym and so I bought them and on Amazon other colors cost more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for walking, running, everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes for larger runners and walkers. I started running again with a budget running shoe and had terrible ankle, knee, and sole problems. I decided to go back to Mizuno running shoes and now I look forward to running and have few problems as I had before. I recommend these for walkers, too, or even everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Disapponting Early Model.
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff and uncortable, initial placing on my feet. Midsole arch of my foot, was in pain, over a mile into my run. I have the Wave Rider 16, 20, Wave Prophecy 3 and 4, and Wave Sky 3, and Wave Knit 4. Glad I didnt spend the original retail price for these. Returned and got my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: Great cushioned shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioned shoe. I liked the lightness of the original Wave Sky shoe better. It was a little heavier than I expected, but still a very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!  Lots of padding
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is SO comfy. The padding is nice and thick, you can feel it as soon as you slip your foot in. Much more comfortable for me to run in (I'm old). This is my 2nd pair of Mizuno shoes, both have been great. I've had these for several months, no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: BenL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from the previous version. The top-end in Mizuno lines. Alternative to Asics Nimbus. Great cushion for 10k to marathon runners (road/bike path). The plastic parts of the outsole do not fit for trial running. The lace tie comes relatively short.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sneaker!!
customer_reviews.text: Best sneaker I’ve ever bought. I used to get ASICS all the time until a 200 dollar shoe wore out on me after a month. I did a little research and decided to roll the dice on these. I am so glad I did!! Very comfortable and long lasting!! Great for heavy set person for running
customer_reviews.author: Chadd

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. Already have pair before in a different color. Had some good runs while wearing them. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not my first Mizunos, but my first Wave Sky models
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several pairs of Mizunos. They are a little stiff out of the box, but they hold up very well. These were no exception. I wore them casually a few times and then on some shorter (3-4 mile) runs to get them broken in. The color is obviously not flashy which is why I got a steal of a deal. I expect to get a solid 400 miles out of these and then get another pair of Mizunos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe, but not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: My wife and son both have a pair of these shoes and really like them, pointing out comfort and support. I thought I'd give them a try as a number of comments implied they were wider than average. Unfortunately, I usually wear a wide shoe, and these were not wide enough for me. Still a very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great for large people
customer_reviews.text: Im 6ft 320 and these shoes help my feet vastly. They come with a great somewhat squishy insert which takes impact off my joints. I do use a custom insert underneath but thats for flat feet. Overall i can say these help my feet not hurt after a long day of work. I use to have bad heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Wrong inserts
customer_reviews.text: My husband started to have issues with this shoes, and just stopped wearing them, I inspected them today and realized the put in two left foot inserts. I would love for the company to send us the right shoe insert . It is really hurting his foot
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Diver

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Received these shoes yesterday. This was at least my 9th or 10th pair of Mizuno running shoes, including the original Wave Sky. I have had good experiences with Mizunos generally and size 11 it he various models I have worn have fit very well. These are much too narrow. I was surprised at how dramatically different the sizing was. I am sure these are a great shoe and I was really looking forward to running in them, but unfortunately I will have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Support and balance.  Completely awesome.
customer_reviews.text: 350 miles and going. Perfect balance of support and comfort. Doesn’t have the marshmallow feel of the Hoka Clifton, but has the support that was lacking for these ridiculously high arches.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Surncle

customer_reviews.title: He loves these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: When my son discovered Mizuno shoes, he won't wear anything else. These particular ones are pretty bright blue, but he loves them anyway. Very comfortable and long wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Considerations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shoe for my daily four-mile 'power walk.' It is a sturdy, comfortable shoe, but I found my size 10 to be too large. I would have done better with a 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: This shoes are so comfortable to run in bu have horrible durability on the upper portion. Mine are 7 months old and have 146 miles on them. The inner padded area on the upper portion of both shoes (right is the worst) has completely worn away. The picture of the pair of ASICS (my prior running shoes) were used for the 2 years prior and have over 300 miles on them with zero wear. Great shoes but if you want something to last the year - I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Finelli

customer_reviews.title: Great Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These were a replacement for my first generation Wave Sky (I was sad to see the old ones go, but I had put a lot of miles on them). These Wave Sky 2 fit well, have held up to many miles and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TheBishop

customer_reviews.title: Wave Sky 2 VS Wave Rider 22
customer_reviews.text: Wave Sky 2 is a good shoe and I wanted to try something different since I have been buying the Wave Riders for several years. But, the Wave Rider just seems to have a better fit / feel. I buy 13 D's. They fit perfectly in the Wave Rider series but are a little too snug in the Wave Sky 2 series. If I had it to do over again, I'd skip the Wave Sky and stick with Wave Riders.
customer_reviews.author: Art Fuller

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes ever! I used to love Brooks Adrenaline GTS. However, these Mizuno's are my new favorite shoes. So much cushion and stability while running.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of mizuno's, this pair and a more expensive pair. These were the most comfortable even though they were the cheaper pair, would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerold R. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not bad ot seems to work as advertised but i will have to put some miles on them before i come to my final conclusion. Mizsunos have fallen apart on me in the past after using them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Running on clouds
customer_reviews.text: The support in these shoes is great! My neighborhood has terribly uneven and hilly sidewalks and was causing knee pain with my old shoes. I won’t lie I was skeptical of these, but a friend who runs marathons recommended these and from the second I took them for a spin I was sold. They are extremely comfortable and keep your feet well protected from the harsh world we run in.
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Wave Riders for almost 20 years and decided to try the Wave Sky for the cushioning. I was very happy with them. Good neutral shoe.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but...
customer_reviews.text: Absorption and fit is great, however, I got blisters after just running 6 miles on a treadmill. The solution was t change the insoles by a Dr. Scholl’s "running", and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Simón Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These awful shoes feels very uncomfortable. The mid sole feels like I'm running with bulge under the insole. I tried buying different insoles to drown the discomfort but none have work. I've started using these shoes after retiring my New Balance Fresh Foam. So unfortunately, I missed the return period. Now I'm stuck with uncomfortable shoes that I have to eventually toss to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: salah

customer_reviews.title: For serious runners.
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno is the best when it comes to running shoes designed and made for serious runners and athletes. This pair is no exception and performs as excpected. Worth every penny and made with quality materials. Super comfortable and gives the neccesary support without being stiff.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Best long lasting support shoe that I love and am loyal to the brand.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been my favorite since I first bought the brand 5 years ago...great support for the feet and knees. I just bought two pair and when i received them today my mom tried them on and loved the comfort so i just ordered her a pair! My brother wants my old pair even though I put over 500 miles on them becuase he said they are more comfortable than his sneakers. He doesnt run though Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had to go an half a size up but probably could have lived with the normal size. I was recommended these shoes from a running store as my podiatrist told me I needed to wear running shoes. They are very comfortable and have great stability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Claerr

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Wave Running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. I look forward to many good years with these shoes and wish I could have found them long ago. Very kind to my feet, especially for as many hours as i spend on them daily.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: The size fits me.
customer_reviews.text: I like Mizuno because the sizing fits me fine. I am 5feet 7inches and 78kg, a perfect Asian feature for these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Great support and cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Have used recently on several runs. Great cushioning, fit and support for a large/tall, 225 lb. + runner. Work great; Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for having a job u can’t sitbat all & looks AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: THESE HAVE BEEN ONE OF THE BEST PAIR ?!!!!!...........MY HISBAND IS A PHARMACIST AND ON HIS FEET 9!-10 a day. He is lucky 🍀 he can wear jeans with a bitten up shirt ..........THESE SNEAKERS BLEND WITH GIS PANTS SO THES PROFESSIONAL LOOKINH ...but still are fun cuz the symbol is bright !!!!! PERFECT PERFECT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: chad r.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoes but not for me
customer_reviews.text: The Mizuno Wave Sky 2 are really good looking and stylish running shoes. (5 Stars). Plantar fasciitis has plagued me ever since I wore the Mizuno Wave Sky 2 the very first time (1 Star). I thought it was imagination but after three days I had to switch back to my Nike’s.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Sooo comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for running. The cushion is superior and provide great support for weak knees and tired feet that want to run. Hands down my favorite shoe purchase to date!
customer_reviews.author: Lolagrad

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a horse
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe if you don't mind the sound of a Clydesdale when walking on pavement. There is a large hollow spot under the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S

customer_reviews.title: Great cushioned running shoe
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I am very happy with this running shoe. I have 2 others and aside from my trail shoes these are perfect for the concrete and pavement with plenty of support and cushion to lower the impact to joints.
customer_reviews.author: Jack R. Arney

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, has good arch support and plenty of cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Good running shoe for people like me who need arch support and don't like to feel every piece of gravel when running.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Wave riders eat your heart out
customer_reviews.text: Been in wave riders since 2010 these were a game changer with how much more comfortable they are
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best comfort running shoe I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I am an Asics guy. Still am. Bought these as they were on sale. Best find ever. Super comfortable. Running on a treadmill feels like I am running on clouds. No knee or foot fatigue. They do run about 1/4 of size small (the nines were a little snug). Just bought another pair but went up 1/2 a size. Great shoe, superior build.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great on concrete
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable. I will be buying another pair as soon as I wear these out. Great while running.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Tom

customer_reviews.title: Style is is different than other mizuno
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased two other mizuno running shoes in a different style . Ordered these in the same size but due to the very fat lip around the back ankle the foot slides out easily.
customer_reviews.author: 0612m

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed my Mizuno for running and long walk, they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love the shoes. They have enough cushion for the ball of your feet as well as heel. Supports my arch perfectly. I have bad knees enough to not make me want to run on pavement but with them i can run without any issues. Highly recommend them to folks that are in a similar position. Disclaimer: please consult a doctor though.
customer_reviews.author: Rashid Haque

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the joints
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand. Mizuno has never disappointed me. Makes runs feels so much easier on the joints. These shoes are a great purchase and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Yuna Kim Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cushioned Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Slightly tighter fit, but very comfortable and well-cushioned running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Fits a little tight for first couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, used these for several years for interval training.
customer_reviews.author: TJS222

customer_reviews.title: different fit from store
customer_reviews.text: My wife tried on this shoe at a local running shoe store and loved it, we found it cheaper online and bought it. There was a huge difference between the two, the online shoe felt like it must have been off the seconds line, very poor cushioning and support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Need to order 1.5 size larger. Shoes is very tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just see for yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Heel padding started tearing on both shoes within the first month or so, with regular use. Normally Mizunos are great, so this was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: TrueRoan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for old Mizuno shoes
customer_reviews.text: These replaced a pair of my favorite Mizuno running shoes. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Harker

customer_reviews.title: Fits and looks great
customer_reviews.text: My Dad loves them. He says that they are the most confortable for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa R.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, especially with lower price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my secoond pair of the wave sky running shoes. Nice shoes for a moderate milage runner (about 10 miles a week) especially since the price reduction. I normally wear around a size 9 and a 9 in these shoes fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good Runner
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and very comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing purchase and a great value for the quality of these shoes. Bought them as a gift for someone who loves running and he had nothing but compliments to the quality of these tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela T Gaspar

customer_reviews.title: Good cushioning but cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Good cushioning ... lace started to wear out after three uses only.
customer_reviews.author: One

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Two pairs in a month and both sole are coming apart. These shoes are super comfortable but bad build quality. No way these are real Mizuno's.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN WOLF

customer_reviews.title: Cool shoes
customer_reviews.text: Previously bought Nike air max torch and they didn’t fit right and were also more expensive. Had mizunos in the past and forgot how good they fit
customer_reviews.author: john raymond

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I ran five miles the day I got them. Felt great. No foot or knee soreness at all. Good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great support and cushion. Fits as expected. I am going to buy another pair!!
customer_reviews.author: Jimj502

customer_reviews.title: Great balance cushioned and nimble.
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe. I'm a 54 y.o. neutral mild pronator with average arch. Shoe is not too bulky or long, not too minimalist, favorite for training, half and marathon. Good balance of cushioning yet nimble. My favorite in my stable of running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: These are well made shoes but I’m not sure how someone runs distance with these. They are bulky and feel somewhat loose in the ankle. I run 30 miles a week and couldn’t make it 5 miles in these
customer_reviews.author: Josh Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking great fit. Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes 3 months in lots of gym miles so holding up. Wish I had two pairs one for everyday use and one to wear around house.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyJam

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big guy and these shoes manage my size perfectly. I’m doing 25-35 miles a week in these and the cushion on these sneakers make them easy
customer_reviews.author: T-Man1970

customer_reviews.title: Great kicks
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my favorite pair of sneakers. Most comfortable pair of tennies I have ever owned and I am in my 50's
customer_reviews.author: T Photo Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my move
customer_reviews.text: Best I’ve worn in quite some time. Lived in Asics but that may we’ll be changing.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best shoes I have ever purchased. I have tried almost every kind of shoe. These are by far one of the best. Will order another pair ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: #1 running sneaker!
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe I’ve ever owned! I’m 53 and my knees don’t allow me to do the things I used to .. the cushion and fit on these sneakers are 2nd to none.. I’m on the treadmill again and will jog outside occasionally..
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Marie Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are just amazing with perfect cushioning required for long run. You'll fee like you are walking on clouds. These are also perfect for any sport.
customer_reviews.author: Harsha

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Rekindled my passion for the past time. Ever since I was 15 I had hip problems when I ran. Now at 22 I feel 14 again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase they're awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow these shoes are really comfortable took em to the gym today and what a difference they make I felt like I was running on air felt great like great balance great shock absorption worth every cent
customer_reviews.author: BethBrian

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the style ans most importantly the cushion when walking. This is my go to sneaker. I bought 2 pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Robin B

customer_reviews.title: Very cushy for standing on your feet for a 11.5 hour work day
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for walking around work, too heavy to use for running.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Birdzell

customer_reviews.title: falls apart after less than two month.
customer_reviews.text: Had Mizuno shoes for many years now, but this one is the poorest quality shoe I have ever had. I would not recommend this shoe to anyone who likes to wear it for more than a few days. It is falling apart after less than two months. Poor materials in heal.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias Naleppa

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: There shoes are very comfortable and they fit well excellent quality I’ve started buying Mizuno since ASICS have been declining in quality. An excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: The Knowest

customer_reviews.title: Best Mizuno yet.
customer_reviews.text: I moved to this shoe from the wave enigma line. Very comfortable, sleek design and a more flexible sole than the enigma line. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John D. shearer

customer_reviews.title: They have to be comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Added another pair because the first exact pair were so comfortable. Decent price through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: Quite Nice
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy. Lots of bounce, arch support, and lightweight. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin holloway

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, work well for running, great support and cushion! Ordered another pair to have ready for when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R Iezek

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for the price. These in the store were double the cost. They are comfortable and great for running or working out
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Balash

customer_reviews.title: Grest shoe for big men who have trouble tieing their shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioning for big men. 6 ft 270 lbs and they are so comfy being on my feet. Tried a lot of other cushioned shoes. These are the ones I always go back to. If only the flexibility to tie my shoes was as good
customer_reviews.author: William Barabas

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great support and very comfortable. After 50K i can tell that they are one of my favorite running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: moshe benollon

customer_reviews.title: Cushioned & support
customer_reviews.text: Like the color and fit to size. Great for walking.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these mizunos they are so comfortable,always bought the horizons but couldn't get my size so thought I'd try these,so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Lorianne Buszinski

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches and this shoe fits and feels great
customer_reviews.author: Paul Shampay

customer_reviews.title: walking with this is like walking on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: this is a perfect shoe i recommend it for anyone who runs a lot everyday
customer_reviews.author: Talal

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Sky 2 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The sky's the limit. Wave sky 2 delivers a maximum cushioned running experience with a premium fit and feel. Newest features include aerohug technology, providing an adaptive fit in motion.
feature_bullets: MIZUNO WAVE: Wave sets the standard for running shoe technologies.
AeroHug technology creates a gentle hug around your foot that allows it to stretch upon impact, yet hold the foot in key areas during the gait cycle.
Engineered Mesh Upper: Both breathable and durable for high performance.
INTERCOOL: Cool and dry. Offers great breathability. Ventilation system reduces heat and humidity build-up inside the shoe during performance.
